did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Jan Williams Collection of Annotated Scores 1950-1999

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: Scores owned by percussionist and conductor, Jan Williams. The majority of the scores were marked by Williams for use in performance. Some scores bear inscriptions from composers to Williams.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], Jan Williams Collection of Annotated Scores, 1950-1999, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Jan Gardner Williams was born July 17, 1939 in Utica, New York. He earned his Bachelor's and Master's Degrees in Music at Manhattan School of Music where he studied percussion with Paul Price and he was a member of the American Symphony Orchestra 1962-1964 under conductor Leopold Stokowski. Williams was selected as one of the first class of Creative Associates for the Center of the Creative and Performing Arts in 1964 at the University at Buffalo. He remained at the University at Buffalo where he created the University at Buffalo Percussion Ensemble in 1964, was appointed to the Music Faculty in 1967, served as Chair of the Music Department 1981-1984, and retired in 1996. He also served as artistic director of the Center of the Creative and Performing Arts 1974-1979 and as its resident conductor 1976-1980. He co-directed the North American New Music Festival with Yvar Mikhashoff 1983-1991.

Jan Williams has performed as solo percussionist with orchestras in Paris, Berlin, Israel, Detroit, New York, and Copenhagen. He has appeared as percussionist, conductor, and instructor throughout the United States and internationally. Composers who have written works for him include John Cage, Elliott Carter, Joel Chadabe, Luis De Pablo, Gustavo Matamoros, Frederic Rzewski, Iannis Xenakis, Morton Feldman, Orlando Garcia, Nils Vigeland, and Lukas Foss. His playing and conducting has been captured on at least three dozen commercial recordings and hundreds of archival recordings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains two hundred sixteen music scores owned by percussionist and conductor Jan Williams. The majority of the scores, chiefly from the 1950s to 1990s, contain markings by Williams (and others) for performing the compositions. While some of the performance markings are negligible, others constitute full realizations of aleatoric compositions. In some cases only handwritten notes indicate how a composition was to be performed.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is basically arranged in alphabetical order by composer name and then by title, with some exceptions.

unittitle.title: Tic : a spectacle for two groups of performers, soloist, films, and tape / William Albright.

physdesc.extent: 1 ms. score ([1] leaf) + 6 ms. parts ; 36 cm.

note.p: Holograph (Ozalid reproduction). Cover title. For any combination of the following: 2 pianos, 2 amplified guitars, 2 percussionists, 2 string basses, and 2 voices. Graphic notation. Duration: 11:46.

unittitle.title: Inventions, instrumental ensemble
[Inventions I-II / Gilbert Amy].

note.p: Ms. (Ink on vellum). For flute, piano/celesta, harp, and vibraphone/marimba. Lacking "Interludes pour harpe" to be played between Inventions I and II; also lacking p.30-39 of the Heugel published score (1964).

unittitle.title: Life pulse music
Charles Ives' life pulse music : for percussion orchestra. / Larry Austin

note.p: Holograph (Photocopy). "Realization drawn from Ives' sketches for his Universe Symphony." Use of multi-track cue tape is strongly recommended by the composer. At end: 2/2/84. Denton, TX. Marked for performance by percussionist and conductor, Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Life pulse prelude. Snare drum cycles
Snare drum cycles : from the Life pulse prelude / Larry Austin

note.p: For solo snare drum. "Based on sketches and plans for percussion orchestra music from a portion of Charles Ives's unfinished Universe Symphony." Inscription on title page. from the composer to Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Haiku
Five Haiku : for young voices and chamber orchestra / by John Bergamo.

note.p: Holograph (Photocopy). For mixed voices (SATB), percussion (4 players), and piano. Instrumentation page indicates parts for Violins 1 and 2, Flute, and Bb clarinet, but no parts for them identified in score. At end of score: "Buffalo, November 10, 1964." Marked for performance by percussionist, conductor Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Shradhanjali : percussion solo with percussion ensemble / by John Bergamo.

note.p: Holograph (Photocopy). Score consists of written, prose instructions. Includes extra copy of instructions. Marked for performance by percussionist, conductor Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Tanka / John Bergamo.

note.p: Holograph (Ozalid copy). Caption title. For solo percussion. At end: March 5, 1964. Marked for performance by percussionist, Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Symphonie fantastique. March to the scaffold; arr.
March to the scaffold : from the "Fantastic symphony" / Hector Berlioz ; arranged for percussion ensemble by Harold Farberman
unittitle.imprint: New York, N.Y. : Cortelu Pub. Co.,

note.p: Arranged for percussion ensemble by Harold Farberman Inscribed by the arranger.

unittitle.title: Tune : per x serie di 5 piatti sospesi / Mario Bertoncini.

note.p: Holograph (Ozalid copy). Caption title. "Rome, 15 ottobre 1965"--Caption. Marked for performance by percussionist, Jan Williams. Performance instructions in Italian ([4] leaves) inserted.

unittitle.title: Lightfall : [for] solo snare drum / Charles Boone.

note.p: Caption title. Holograph (Photocopy). Score consists of typed, numerical patterns. Performance instructions and personal note from composer to percussionist, Jan Williams, inserted.

unittitle.title: Watts towers : for solo drummer / Charles Boone.

physdesc.extent: [6] ms. leaves of music ; 26 x 33 cm.

note.p: Ms. (Photocopy). Caption title. For one percussionist playing "an array of six drums: concert bongos, tomtoms, snares (snares off), floor tomtoms, etc." Duration: 8:00. Leaves mounted on cardboard backing. Marked for performance by percussionist, Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Pli selon pli. Improvisation sur Mallarmé, no. 1
Improvisation sur Mallarmé : le vierge, le vivace et le bel aujourd'hui / Pierre Boulez

note.p: For soprano, harp, vibraphone, bells, and percussion (4 players). Two photocopies of Universal Edition score (pl. no. U.E. 12855 LW) marked as percussion parts, cut and pasted onto cardboard backings. Prepared by John Bergamo. Acc. by personal note (3 ms. pages) from Bergamo to Jan Williams. Duration: 06:00.

unittitle.title: Sig-mords : for solo percussion : opus 40 / L. Brewaeys.

note.p: Holograph (Photocopy). At end of score: 13-11-80. Inscription on title page. from the composer. Marked for performance.

unittitle.title: Calder piece : for 4 percussionists and mobile / Earle Brown.

note.p: Holograph (Photocopy). Caption title. For 4 percussionists, performed with mobile by Alexander Calder. Marked for performance by percussionist, Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Folio, no. 2. Selections
[Folio II / Earle Brown].

note.p: Holographs (Photocopies). For indeterminate instrumentation. Graphic notation. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams. Includes ms. note (1 leaf) by Eberhard Blum about performance of "for Ann" and additional, unmarked photocopy of same work.

unittitle.title: Folio, no. 2. Selections
Folio II : after 1970 / [Earle Brown].

physdesc.extent: [5] leaves of ms. music ; 21 x 28 cm.

note.p: Holographs (Photocopies). Title from leaf 1 of "Remarks for performers." Graphic notation. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Hodograph, no. 1
Hodograph 1 / Earle Brown

note.p: Holograph (Photocopy). For flute, piano, celeste, orchestral bells, Vibraphone, and marimba (3 players). At end of score: June 1959 N.Y.C. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Sources, no. 3
Sources III : for two performers (clarinet and percussion) / David Burge
unittitle.imprint: [S.l.] : Tetra Music Corp. ;New York, N.Y. : Sole selling agent : A. Broude,

note.p: Performance score. Reproduced from holograph. At end of score: "January 25, 1967 Boulder, Colorado." Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Sticks of eloquence : for multiple percussion solo / Michael Burritt
unittitle.imprint: Cleveland, Ohio (557 E. 140th St., Cleveland 44110-1999) : Ludwig Music,

note.p: Inscribed by the composer.

unittitle.title: Fogli. Coeur
Sette fogli : una collezione occulta.[Coeur] / Sylvano Bussotti

note.p: Title from caption on instruction sheet. Consists of: photocopies of performance instructions (1 leaf) and score (1 leaf) from Universal Edition (pl. no. 13238) publication; photocopy of same score marked in preparation for realization; score realized by Jan Williams (1 folded leaf, April 2001); and 1 leaf of pencil ms. notes by Jan Williams. Graphic notation.

unittitle.title: Atlas eclipticalis / John Cage
unittitle.imprint: New York : Henmar Press : C.F. Peters,

note.p: "Instrumental parts to be played in whole or part in any ensemble, chamber or orchestral, with or without Winter music." Percussion I part, reproduced from holograph. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Composed improvisation, snare drum
C : composed improvisation : for snare drum / John Cage

note.p: Score consists of performance instructions. Includes realization (1991) by percussionist Jan Williams: list of instruments (1 leaf); 5 leaves ms. notes; realization (3 ms. leaves plus 1 photocopy of same leaves), amplifier operator score (1 ms. leaf; 1 typescript leaf plus photocopy of same leaf).

unittitle.title: Music for ... : parts for flute, clarinet, trombone, three percussion, piano, violin, and cello without score (no fixed relation), title to be completed by adding to "Music for"--The number of players performing / John Cage
unittitle.imprint: New York : Henmar Press : Sole selling agents : C.F. Peters,

note.p: Cover title. Percussion I part. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams. Includes published performance instructions and additional notes by Jan Williams (1 ms. leaf).Photocopy.

unittitle.title: Music for ... : parts for voice and instruments without score (no fixed relation), title to be completed by adding to "Music for"--The number of players performing / John Cage
unittitle.imprint: New York : Henmar Press : [Sole selling agents, C.F. Peters],

note.p: Percussion IV part. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams. Includes published performance instructions, additional notes by Jan Williams (7 ms. leaves), and additional photocopy of leaves 1-4 of the part (also marked).Photocopy.

unittitle.title: Music for ... : parts for voice and instruments without score (no fixed relation), title to be completed by adding to "Music for"--The number of players performing / John Cage
unittitle.imprint: New York : Henmar Press : [Sole selling agents, C.F. Peters],

note.p: Percussion IV part. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams. Includes published performance instructions. Photocopy.

unittitle.title: Ryoanji / John Cage

note.p: Caption title. Printed part of ensemble player A. "At least two only slightly resonant instruments of different material (wood and metal, not metal and metal) played in unison"--Leaf [2]. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams. Includes 2nd photocopy of part (21 cm.).Photocopy.

unittitle.title: She is asleep. Quartet
She is asleep. Quartet, 12 tom toms / John Cage

note.p: For 4 players, 3 tom toms each graduated in pitch. "Edition Peters"--Cover. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams. Includes additional photocopy of score.

unittitle.title: 27'10.544" : for a percussionist / John Cage

note.p: Reproduced from holograph. Photocopied clippings which make reference to Marcel Duchamp are taped into the score at various places. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Variations, no. 3
[Variations III / John Cage]

note.p: Lacking score; contains published performance instructions, 1 envelope of circles on transparencies, [4] leaves of notes for realization by Jan Williams (4/13/95). For one or any number of people performing any actions.

unittitle.title: Pieces, timpani
Eight pieces : for four timpani (one player) / Elliott Carter

note.p: Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams; some pages duplicated to ease page-turning.

unittitle.title: Pieces, timpani
Eight pieces : for four timpani (one player) / Elliott Carter

note.p: Inscription on title page. from the composer to percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Pieces, timpani
Eight pieces : for four timpani (one player) / Elliott Carter

note.p: Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Pieces, timpani. Selections
[Eight pieces for four timpani : revised score / Elliott Carter].

note.p: Holograph (Ozalid copy). Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams, with markings by the composer.

unittitle.title: Pieces, timpani. Recitative
Recitative and improvisation : for four kettledrums (one player) / Elliott Carter

note.p: Both movements incorporated into Eight pieces for timpani in 1968 published score. Duration: 6:45. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Pieces, timpani. Recitative
Recitative and improvisation : for four kettledrums (one player) / Elliott Carter

note.p: Both movements incorporated into Eight pieces for timpani in 1968 published score. Duration: 6:45. Typescript notes (1 leaf) by the composer inserted. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Pieces, timpani. Selections
Six pieces : for kettledrums (4) : 1950 / Elliott Carter.

note.p: Holograph (Photocopy). For one percussionist. At end: Tucson, Nov. 1950. "Property of Paul Price"--stamp on title page., crossed out. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Echoes : for percussion and electronics / Joel Chadabe.

note.p: Holograph (Photocopy). For percussionist and assistant with microphone; or with accompanying pre-recorded tape of echoes. Graphic notation. At end of score: Albany, 9/2/72. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams. Typescript performance instructions (1 leaf, photocopied) inserted.

unittitle.title: Flyby / Joel Chadabe.

note.p: Ms. notes by Jan Williams in preparation for April 20, 1991 performance of work for percussion and MIDI electronics at North American New Music Festival.

unittitle.title: Follow me softly / Chadabe.

note.p: Caption title. Ms. notes by Jan Williams in preparation for April 12, 1984 performance of work for percussion at North American New Music Festival.

unittitle.title: Rhythms : for percussion and computer / Joel Chadabe.

note.p: Caption title. Manuscript. "The percussionist may accompany, be accompanied by, complement and/or articulate rhythms generated by, or improvise melodies with, the computer"--Instructions. Includes performance instructions and description of one realization by Jan Williams. Another copy of realization (3 leaves) laid in container.

unittitle.title: Round trip / Chadabe.

note.p: Caption title. Ms. notes by Jan Williams in preparation for April 5, 1992 performance of work for percussion and computer at North American New Music Festival.

unittitle.title: Light spirit / by Michael Colgrass.

note.p: Holograph (Ozalid copy) Percussion I and II part. Cover title. For flute, viola, guitar, and percussion, 2 players. Performance instructions on verso of cover. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Madrigals, book 1
Madrigals : book I for soprano, vibraphone, and contrabass / George Crumb

note.p: Caption title. Reproduced from ms. Spanish words and phonetics; text from poems by Federico García Lorca; also printed as texts with English translations. Includes performance instructions. "The 4 books of Lorca madrigals may be performed: (a) as separate works ... (b) as a larger cycle in which the 4 books are played in sequence"--Performance notes. At end: 1965 Buffalo, N.Y. Marked for performance (minimally) by percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Melodia Nera : (1980-1982) : timpani solo / Rocco Di Pietro
unittitle.imprint: Lancaster, NY (P.O. Box 436, Lancaster, NY 14086) : A.M. Percussion Publications,

note.p: Includes performance instructions. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams. Inscription on title page. from the composer to Jan and Diane Williams.

unittitle.title: Overture, organ, synthesizer, percussion
Overture : [for] percussion orchestra / Rocco Di Pietro.

note.p: Reproduced from holograph. Handwritten emendations by the composer. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams. "[For] percussion orchestra, organ and synthesizer"--Caption. At end: November- Fine- December 1980 R.D.P. Handwritten quotations from Richard Wagner and Luigi Russolo on l. 1A.

unittitle.title: Overture, organ, synthesizer, percussion
Overture to Combats for history : per gruppi di percussione, organo e sintetizzante = [for] percussion orchestra, organ and synthesizer instruments / Rocco Di Pietro.

note.p: Holograph (Ozalid reproduction). Caption title. Original title blacked out: Overature. "For Jan Williams"--At top of page. "For percussion orchestra - 80 instruments in six groups - 12-15 players"--Caption. Prefatory leaf contains lists of percussion instruments in six groups. Changes to sectional durations changed on leaf [8]; prefatory leaf marked by percussionist Jan Williams with list of instruments needed to acquire. At end of score: November- Fine- December 1980 R.D.P.

unittitle.title: Popular songs
Three popular songs : per soprano, pianoforte e percussione (1984) ; op. 74 no. 1 / Rocco Di Pietro ; di testi su Luis A. Rosario Quiles, Bertolt Brecht, e Allen Pettersson.

note.p: Caption title. Reproduced from holograph. For soprano, piano, and percussion. English words. At end: May 27, 1984. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Duos, violin, percussion
Sei duo : per violino e percussioni / Dubrovay László

note.p: Duration: about 7 min. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: La mariée mise à par ses cé libataires même / Marcel Duchamp ; realization by Petr Kotík,

note.p: Photocopy of Kotík holograph. Title from added title page. For alto flute, celeste, trombone, glockenspiel, and marimba. At end: October 22, 1974. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Lines from twenty poems
Three lines from twenty poems : for chamber orchestra / David Felder.

note.p: For tape and orchestra: 1_2_1_1_/1121/timp, perc(2)/hrp/pno/str (6-6-5-5-4). Based on the writings of Pablo Neruda. Reproduced from signed holograph. Duration: ca. 8:45. "Commissioned by the Research Foundation of S.U.N.Y. with the assistance of the Jory Fund of the American Music Center." Marked for performance by conductor Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Crippled symmetry / Morton Feldman.

note.p: Holograph (Ozalid copy). For flute (bass flute), vibraphone (glockenspiel), and piano (celesta). Caption title. "C1983 Universal EDT."--Inscription bottom of leaf 1. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams. "1st perf. Akademie der Künste, Berlin, Feb. 5, 1984, [Eberhard] Blum, [Nils] Vigeland, [Jan] Williams"--Bottom of leaf 1.

unittitle.title: For Philip Guston / Morton Feldman.

note.p: Holograph (Ozalid copy). For flute (piccolo, alto flute), percussion (1 player, including vibraphone, glockenspiel, chimes, marimba), and piano (celesta). Caption title. "C1984 Universal EDT"--Bottom of p. 1. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams. Score disbound; individual sheets re-ordered, and some duplicated, to facilitate page-turning. At end of score: Nov. 9, 1984.

unittitle.title: Instruments, no. 1
Instruments : [I] / Morton Feldman.

note.p: Holograph (Ozalid copy). For alto flute, oboe, trombone, celesta and percussion. Caption title. "Commissioned by the S.E.M. Ensemble"--Caption. "Copyright Universal EDT 1974"--Bottom of leaf 1. At end of score: July 29, 1974. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams. All staves of percussion part replaced with new staves on manuscript paper with notation of percussion part enlarged.

unittitle.title: Instruments, no. 3
Instruments III / Morton Feldman.

note.p: Holograph (Ozalid copy). For flute (alto flute, piccolo), oboe (English horn), and percussion. Caption title. "Copyright Universal EDT 1977"--Bottom of leaf 1. At end of score: July 15, '77. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: The King of Denmark : percussion / Morton Feldman

note.p: For solo percussionist. Cover title. At end of score: Aug. 1964. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams. Includes additional 9 leaves: 1 heavily marked photocopy of score; 1 photocopy of leaf 1 of score; 5 leaves containing diagrams of instrument set-up and lists of instruments required.

unittitle.title: Why patterns? / M. Feldman.

note.p: Holograph (Ozalid copy). For flute (doubling alto & bass flute), piano and glockenspiel. Caption title. At end of score: April, 1978. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams. Markings include some changes to score.

unittitle.title: A serenade for six : for flute, clarinet/bass clarinet, violin, cello, percussion, and piano / Richard Festinger.

note.p: Computer printout of percussion part. Dedicated to the New York New Music Ensemble. Performance instructions on verso of title page. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Hinomi : for solo percussionist / Michael Finnissy.

physdesc.extent: 7 p. of ms. music ; 28 x 41 cm.

note.p: Reproduced from holograph. Composer's instructions, in English, prelim. p. Cover title. At end of score: December 1979. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Boatsong / Andrew Ford.

note.p: Reproduced from holograph. For bass clarinet or alto saxophone, and marimba or vibraphone. "Commissioned by Henri Bok and Evert Le Mair, the Duo Contemporain, and is dedicated to them." On verso: Andrew Ford Menston, Yorkshire 1982. At end: "Andrew Ford, March-August 1982, Isle of Skye- Sutton Valence." Duration: ca. 10:00. Inscription on title page. from the composer to percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Concertos, percussion, orchestra
Concerto for solo percussion and large or small orchestra : 1973-74 / Lukas Foss.

note.p: Holograph (Ozalid copy). Chance composition. Duration: 29:00 (large orchestra version); 29:00 or 47:00 (small orchestra version). "Commissioned by the Ford Foundation for Jan Williams"--2nd. title page. Stamp on title page.: Editions Salabert Rental Library. List of instruments and their stage positions attached to front cover. Score marked #2.

unittitle.title: Concertos, percussion, orchestra
Concerto for solo percussion and large or small orchestra / Lukas Foss

physdesc.extent: 1 score (29 p.) ; 26 x 36 cm. + 2 parts ; 33-36 cm.

note.p: Chance composition. Composer's performance instructions on p. 3-5. Duration: 30:00 (short version); 46:00 (long version). "Commissioned by the Ford Foundation for Jan Williams"--At head of title. Stamp on title page.: Editions Salabert Rental Library. Violin and Percussion parts included, with additional pages. Score marked P#4. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams. Additional materials inserted: 2 photocopies of typescript program notes; equipment list and set-up diagram (4 leaves); enlarged portions of score (ms.) for placement on different percussion stands (6 leaves); 4 more leaves of miscellaneous notes.

unittitle.title: Concertos, percussion, orchestra
Concerto for solo percussion and large or small orchestra : 1973-74 / Lukas Foss.

note.p: Holograph (Photocopy). Chance composition. Duration: 29:00 (large orchestra version); 29:00 or 47:00 (small orchestra version). "Commissioned by the Ford Foundation for Jan Williams"--2nd. title page. Stamp on title page.: Editions Salabert. Disbound loose leaves. Heavily marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Concertos, percussion, orchestra
Concerto for solo percussion and large or small orchestra : 1973-74 / Lukas Foss.

note.p: Holograph (Photocopy). Chance composition. Duration: 29:00 (large orchestra version); 29:00 or 47:00 (small orchestra version). "Commissioned by the Ford Foundation for Jan Williams"--2nd. title page. Loose leaves. "Revised April 1975 after performances April 10, 11 + 13 with NJ Symphony (Jesse Levine)." Includes 5 additional leaves, marked "Large version", of enlarged ms. for placement on percussion stands. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Curriculum vitae with time-bomb : for percussion solo and taped or live accordeon [sic] : 1980 / Lukas Foss.

note.p: Printed Pembroke Music score (1978) of Curriculum vitae, for solo accordion, with ms. addition of percussion part. "For Jan Williams." Performance instructions on title page. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams. Additional materials inserted: 1 extra photocopy of score (22 x 36 cm.) with additional markings, and list of percussion instruments required.

unittitle.title: Map / Lukas Foss.

note.p: Typescript, with pencil annotations by the composer. For four performers and electronic tapes.

unittitle.title: Ni bruit ni vitesse : for piano keys (pianist) and piano strings (percussionist) / Lukas Foss.

note.p: Holograph (Photocopy). For 2 pianos and 2 percussionists (playing on the piano strings) or 1 piano, 1 percussionist, and tape; in part, aleatoric. Duration: 13:00. Performance instructions on title page. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Ni bruit ni vitesse : for piano keys (pianist) and piano strings (percussionist) / Lukas Foss.

note.p: Holograph (Photocopy). "Final draft." For 2 pianos and 2 percussionists (playing on the piano strings) or 1 piano, 1 percussionist, and tape; in part, aleatoric. Duration: 13:30. Performance instructions on title page. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: [Paradigm / Lukas Foss].

note.p: Title page lacking. Holograph (Ozalid copy). For percussionist/conductor, electric guitar (or sitar) and three other unspecified instruments capable of sustaining a sound. Narration performed by the instrumentalists; also requires tape recorder. Text in English with some German and French translations. Duration: ca. 17:30. Includes performance instructions. Leaves numbered: 1A, 2A, 2B, 2C, 3, 4A, 4B, 4C. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Paradigm : for percussionist/conductor, electric guitar (or sitar) and three other instruments capable of sustaining a sound / Lukas Foss.

note.p: Holograph (Ozalid and photocopy). Folder containing scores (also used as parts) and additional materials (including pitch choices) compiled by the composer for performance of the work. Narration performed by the instrumentalists; also requires tape recorder. Text in English with some German and French translations. Duration: ca. 17:30. Includes performance instructions. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams and other performers. Four movements: I. Session -- II. Reading -- III. Recital -- IV. Lecture.

unittitle.title: Paradigm : for percussionist/conductor (one man), electric guitar or electric sitar [and] three other instruments capable of sustaining a sound / Lukas Foss
unittitle.imprint: Mainz : B. Schott's Söhne ; New York : C. Fischer,

note.p: Scores (with 1 additional photocopy) compiled by percussionist/conductor Jan Williams; used as parts and marked for performance. Narration performed by the instrumentalists; also requires tape recorder. Duration: about 18 min.

unittitle.title: Solo observed / [Lukas Foss].

note.p: Ms. (Photocopy). Caption title. "This work is an extended version of Solo, for piano, involving the addition of a coda consisting of vibraphone or marimba, violoncello or harp, and electronic organ or accordion reflecting on the pianist's solo which they "observe"--Lukas Foss: a bio-bibliography / Karen L. note.p: Caption title. Spiral is a composition by Karlheinz Stockhausen for vocal or instrumental soloist and short-wave radio. Electronic amplification and other electronic devices may also be used. These ms. notes were written by percussionist Jan Williams in preparation for performance of the piece.

Scores to be used as parts in combination with separately written parts for musically independent sections. Includes performance instructions. Part of Player 4 (Vibraphone B) wanting. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams. Typescript note from the composer to Jan Williams (1 leaf) inserted.

A[lbright]-K[nox] Gallery, 3/31/85"--Caption. Includes photocopy of p. 11-20 of the Universal Edition vocal score (UE 12889) of excerpt, with Feldman's markings for his arrangement. unittitle.title: Exercises / [Christian Wolff]

note.p: Title from caption of performance instructions. Reproduced from holograph. For any number of instruments, any number of players. Includes instructions for performance. Includes 5 leaves of ms. notes by Jan Williams. Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams. Consists of 1 complete copy of Exercises 1-18, with duplicates of Exercises 1 (incomplete), 3, 6, 7, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 18. The scores are divided into two groups. The first group, heavily marked for performance, consists of Exercises 1-3, 6-12, and 18. The 2nd group consists of Exercises 1 (incomplete), 3-7, 9-13, 14a, 14b, 15-18.Photocopy.

unittitle.title: Selections
In a fish tank / Gustavo Matamoros.

note.p: Photocopies and computer-generated printouts. Title from printout of email concert notice. Materials used by Jan Williams for the Dec. 4, 1996 concert titled In a fish tank at Merkin Hall, New York City, of multiple pieces by Gustavo Matamoros. Includes printout of email notice of concert (1 leaf) and 3 leaves with start times for pieces, including Pocket change and More or less, or Time is money, from Music on a budget, each with descriptions of actions to be taken by Jan Williams.

unittitle.title: Interplay : a histrionic controversy for four musicians / by Sydney Hodkinson.

Marked for performance by percussionist Jan Williams. Performing notes: p. A22-A24. Duration: ca. 12 min. At end of score: October 1966, Windsor, Ontario, Ann Arbor, Michigan.

unittitle.title: Octet : original version / Vigeland.

note.p: Holograph (Photocopy). Title from accompanying envelope. For percussion (glockenspiel, vibraphone, marimba and 2 timpani) [1 player], clarinet (B? and bass), piano, string quartet .

unittitle.title: Octet : 1978 : for percussion (glockenspiel, vibraphone, marimba and 2 timpani), clarinet (B? and bass), piano, string quartet / by Nils Vigeland.

physdesc.extent: 1 ms. score (72 p.) ; 22 x 28 cm. + 5 parts ; 28-36 cm.

note.p: Holograph (Photocopy). At end of score: South Bend, 2/19/78; rev. Dobbs Ferry, 1/80. Score contains numerous corrections and performance markings; some pages replaced by photocopies and additional photocopied pages have been inserted into the original sequence of pages. Parts incomplete: string quartet parts (with duplicate of viola) and percussion; marked for performance. Duration: ca. 17:00. Accompanied by correspondence from Nils Vigeland to Diane and Jan Williams, and from Diane Williams to John Duffy of Meet the Composer (6 leaves ms. and typescript).

unittitle.title: Mating dance / Per Nørgård.

note.p: Photocopy of ms. Caption title. For flute and guitar; score marked by percussionist Erik Jacobsen to be performed by flute and percussion (crotales, marimba, and vibraphone). Includes prefatory leaf of performance instructions for the first version of this work which was titled Returns and was for solo guitar. At end of score: "Kbh. 25/11 - 77". Includes typescript letter (1 leaf) dated Jan. 26, 1979 from Erik Jacobsen to percussionist Jan Williams with an explanation of how the present version came about and performance instructions.

unittitle.title: Ceremony, no. 1-2
Ceremony. 1-7 / David Mott.

note.p: For flute with percussion (1 player). Spine title. Holograph (Ozalid reproduction). Author's signature appears on first leaf of music. Score has been annotated with performance notes for percussionist. Includes 1 leaf of instructions, 3 leaves of performance notes. Ceremony 3 is missing; Ceremony 4 is reproduced four times. Percussion part marked by Jan Williams for performance.

otherfindaid.head: Additional Guides
otherfindaid.p: All scores in the collection are cataloged in WorldCat and are available in BISON, the online catalog for the University at Buffalo Libraries, by performing a "Title begins with" search under "Jan Williams Collection of Annotated Scores".

relatedmaterial.head: Related Resources in the Music Library

defitem.label: Jan Williams Collection of Images, 1950-1999 Mus. Arc. 2.3
defitem.item: The Jan Williams Collection of Images contain images of various performances and trips made by Jan Williams with accompanying performers and composers. An original gift was received of 321 prints and contact sheets and 54 35mm slides in 2007. An additional gift was received of 173 photographs in 2008.

defitem.label: Morton Feldman Images by Jan Williams, 1974-1979 Mus. Arc. 10.1
defitem.item: The Morton Feldman Images by Jan Williams date from concert tours made by Morton Feldman and the University at Buffalo's Creative Associates in 1974, 1977, and 1979.
